critique: This document primarily concerns international organizations and their immunities within the US legal framework. It designates three entities—the Inter-American Investment Corporation, the Commission for the Study of Alternatives to the Panama Canal, and the Pacific Salmon Commission—as public international organizations entitled to certain privileges and immunities under US law. It also delegates certain presidential functions related to the Inter-American Investment Corporation to the Secretary of the Treasury. The document does not directly address issues of ideological tilt, immigration, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion in a substantive way. Therefore, most scores should be neutral. The delegation of power to the Secretary of Treasury could be seen as a slight restraint on executive power.
